content:
Diagnosis:
Locally advanced gastric adenocarcinoma (poorly cohesive type)
Stage T3N2M0 at diagnosis January 2024
PDL1 CPS 8, MMR proficient

Previous treatment:
Neoadjuvant FLOT chemotherapy commenced February 2024
Completed 3 cycles to date

Current medications:
Ondansetron 8mg BD
Dexamethasone 4mg BD days 1-3 of each cycle
Pantoprazole 40mg OD

Current situation:
Pre-cycle 4 FLOT assessment

I reviewed [redacted name] today prior to cycle 4 FLOT chemotherapy. The third cycle was generally well tolerated with only grade 1 fatigue and mild peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips. His appetite has improved since the dose reduction of 5-FU implemented at cycle 3, and his weight has stabilized at 72kg. Performance status remains 1.

On examination today, the epigastric mass is no longer palpable suggesting good clinical response. Latest bloods show stable parameters with hemoglobin 11.2, neutrophils 2.8, platelets 156. LFTs and renal function remain normal.

Endoscopic assessment last week showed good partial response with reduction in primary tumor bulk. CT scan is scheduled prior to cycle 6 to formally assess response.

The plan is to proceed with cycle 4 FLOT today at current doses. We will continue with primary GCSF prophylaxis. [redacted name] will be reviewed again before cycle 5 in three weeks' time.
